trao nguoc da day thuc quan.json. What is gastroesophageal reflux?
Gastroesophageal reflux disease (GERD), or gastroesophageal reflux, is a very common gastrointestinal disease in Vietnam. In normal people, after food is put into the mouth and down to the esophagus, the esophageal sphincter relaxes to let food and liquid enter the stomach and then closes again. However, people with gastric reflux will experience acid from the stomach refluxing into the esophagus (this is the tube connecting the mouth to the stomach), causing the lining of the esophagus to become irritated and causing many problems. unpleasant symptoms. (first)
